image.altText: a middle aged white man with receding grey hair and glasses weaing a suit sitting in front of a painting of wattle and flags

props.synopsis: A long-awaited report by Special Envoy to Combat Islamophobia Aftab Malik is being handed down. Follow live.

title.children: PM launches envoy's plan to tackle Islamophobia

image.altText: Aerial shot of Rockingham beach, houses, garden island and the causeway to the island.

props.synopsis: The head of Australia's submarine agency says planning is so far advanced to settle the American soldiers that quarantine arrangements for their pets are underway.

title.children: Inside the plan to station 1,200 Americans and their subs near Perth

image.altText: A compilation of images showing university names.

props.synopsis: With the university sector in crisis, thousands face losing their jobs as unions blame poor management and students say they've lost hope.

title.children: University staff 'disheartened and demoralised' as thousands sacked

image.altText: Charlie Kirk speaks at Utah Valley University, prior to being shot and killed, on 10 September 2025

props.synopsis: Authorities say a new video shows the suspect jumping off the roof of a Utah Valley University building before fleeing into a nearby wooded area.

title.children: Footage shows suspected gunman fleeing scene after Charlie Kirk shooting

image.altText: Matt Kean, Chris Bowen, Anthony Albanese

props.synopsis: A growing cross-factional group within Labor is privately urging for Australia's next major climate target to respect the advice of the Climate Change Authority, which will hand its opinion on a 2035 target to government any day.

title.children: Growing group of Labor MPs urge 2035 emissions target above Climate Authority's floor

image.altText: Trump stands in front of a US flag saluting

props.synopsis: In a country with more guns than people, an increasingly violent and threatening public discourse is creating serious dangers.

title.children: A bitter blame game is pushing the US towards the precipice

image.altText: Four Diamonds players stand in line and clap and smile

props.synopsis: Netball Australia and the players' association strike a landmark revenue-sharing deal as part of a three-year collective player agreement.

title.children: Netball players to get share of Diamonds' revenue in landmark deal

image.altText: An Aldi shopping cart

props.synopsis: Online shopping scams are now one of the most frequently reported scam types and experts say they are alarmingly common, impersonating well-known brands and being promoted in search engine advertisements.

title.children: More Australian consumers are falling for mimic shopping websites

image.altText: Seven women, including Nisha Khot, wear sarees, stand in front of film posters, saying now showing in a cinema hall.

props.synopsis: Nearly two weeks after the "March for Australia" rallies, the Indian Australian community continues to grapple with the political targeting of the diaspora.

title.children: Indian Australians urge Jacinta Nampijinpa Price to apologise to help community 'heal'

image.altText: Sussan Ley ABC

props.synopsis: The fracas over Jacinta Nampijinpa Price shows the Liberal party is a seething mass of frustrated ambition, resentment, tribalism and deep ideological division.

title.children: What hope do the Liberals have if one rebellious senator brought a crisis?

image.altText: Jayne Hrdlicka_Brisbane Airport.jpg

props.synopsis: The ASX rises, as do Virgin shares, as the airline reveals the exit pay of its former CEO. Mixed data out of the US economy sees expectations of a Federal Reserve rate cut next week solidify. Follow the day's events and insights on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: Virgin reveals $50 million payday for ex-boss Jayne Hrdlicka

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: UBS tips gold price to hit $US3,800 by year-end
VIDEO: The rise of K-beauty products in Australia

image.altText: Peter Mandelson and Keir Starmer walking down a hallway smiling

props.synopsis: After dogging the US president for months, evidence of a connection to Jeffrey Epstein has claimed a senior scalp within the British government.

title.children: How the Jeffrey Epstein saga spread to British politics

image.altText: An elderly man sips on a drink with a straw in front of more than a dozen cupcakes.

props.synopsis: States and territories will use a health ministers' meeting today to call on the federal government to do more to address what they say is a critical aged care crisis affecting hospitals around the nation.

title.children: 'A tragedy': 2,500 elderly patients stuck in hospital waiting for aged care

image.altText: Yuna sits down on the floor while Minu holds a mickey mouse toy.

props.synopsis: Hakyung Lee is accused of murdering her children, eight-year-old Yuna Jo and six-year-old Minu Jo, and leaving their remains in suitcases at a storage facility in Auckland.

title.children: Court hears of NZ mother's 'descent into madness' before children's deaths

image.altText: A close-up of Emmanuel Macron frowning.

props.synopsis: France is stuck in a cycle of political chaos, with no clear end in sight. It has sparked calls for President Emmanuel Macron's resignation and has become so dire that another round of snap legislative elections is considered possible.

title.children: Macron is so unpopular in France, many say resignation is his only option

image.altText: A police car with its lights on.

props.synopsis: Police allege two men fatally shot a man in Melbourne two days after shooting another dead.

title.children: Two men charged with murder allegedly involved in second fatal shooting

image.altText: A close-up of a cat's mouth and whiskers.

props.synopsis: A regional South Australian council has publicly apologised to a family whose lost pet was euthanased after it was mistaken for a feral cat.

title.children: 'Beloved' pet euthanased after being mistaken for feral cat

image.altText: Two men in suits outside court.

props.synopsis: James Fitzgerald and Alexander Papanastassis are charged with negligent manslaughter over the death of Luke Briggs, who died eight days after his arrest last year.

title.children: Police officers face court over death of Luke Briggs

image.altText: Brazil's former president Jair Bolsonaro addresses rally

props.synopsis: The former Brazilian president, Jair Bolsonaro, has been sentenced to 27 years in prison at the age of 70 and may spend the rest of his life behind bars.

title.children: Ex-Brazilian president Jair Bolsonaro found guilty of coup charges

image.altText: Wallaroos forward Ashley Fernandez catches the ball in a line out during a women's rugby test against Wales.

props.synopsis: Australia's Wallaroos are dreaming of an unlikely World Cup semifinal berth, but they will need to get past a team they have never beaten before.

title.children: Wallaroos targeting World Cup quarterfinal boilover

image.altText: Computer accessories, including keyboards and hard drives, lay on top of each other in a blue collection bin

props.synopsis: A cybercrime expert says trading or recycling electronics may not completely erase personal data and users should adopt a "risk-adjusted strategy" when disposing of devices.

title.children: Think about data safety when disposing of old devices, recyclers say

image.altText: Mariah Carey performs between two black male dancers.

props.synopsis: A lot happened this week. Have you been paying attention?

title.children: Weekly news quiz: A lunar eclipse, the VMAs and a new richest person

image.altText: A collapsed building with dirty flood water rushing past in West Denpasar, Bali.

props.synopsis: Authorities are still cleaning up following the disaster, which hit two islands in the archipelago amid warnings more rain could fall in affected areas in coming days.

title.children: Australian in Bali says she's never seen anything like recent floods

image.altText: A woman in red dress.

props.synopsis: After days of deadly violence, protest organisers have met with Nepal's army to try to plot a path forward for the country, which has a deep distrust of democratic politics.

title.children: After uniting to upend Nepal politics, Gen Z looks to appoint leader

image.altText: A child's hands holding a red capsicum wrapped in plastic.

props.synopsis: Industry is cautiously moving ahead with a new soft plastic recycling system in the wake of the REDcycle disaster. How will it work, and can we really have a circular soft plastic system in Australia?

title.children: Supermarkets are collecting soft plastics again, as recycling trial expands

image.altText: vogel gfx

props.synopsis: The man in charge of the Northern Territory government's handling of a major methane leak at a Santos gas plant was working with a lobbyist for the project's co-owner.

title.children: Regulator in gas leak 'scandal' had paid role with industry lobbyist

image.altText: A woman with short blonde hair smiles, with black and whit images of protesters holding signs reading "our ANU" behind her.

props.synopsis: The announcement of vice-chancellor Genevieve Bell's resignation on Thursday was greeted with cheers, however the view on campus is that this alone will not reverse the erosion of trust and morale that has already occurred.

title.children: Bishop says ANU is 'turning a page', but many argue it can't with her as chancellor

image.altText: A man in a suit sits on a leather lounge, looking professional.

props.synopsis: Community leaders say the government must consider social and legal reforms to address a spike in Islamophobic incidents.

title.children: Muslim groups welcome Islamophobia report amid harassment spike

image.altText: Yuval Raphael wearing a black fitted suit with long tassels hanging from arms, arms out, holding mic, singing on stage

props.synopsis: Irish national broadcaster RTE has said Ireland will not participate in Eurovision 2026 if Israel does, citing the ongoing and appalling loss of lives in Gaza.

title.children: Ireland threatens Eurovision boycott if Israel takes part

image.altText: A portrait shot of a smiling woman.

props.synopsis: The acclaimed author's father was a greyhound trainer and her mother ran a TAB. Her unconventional childhood inspired her eighth book, Tenderfoot.

title.children: Toni Jordan grew up at the greyhound track. It inspired her latest novel

image.altText: A man in a dark suit and checkered tie speaks to reporters

props.synopsis: Basil Zempilas has been vocal in giving his federal party colleagues advice, but the events of the last week show just how difficult the job of uniting the WA Liberals truly is.

title.children: How taking a stand became a headache for Basil Zempilas

image.altText: Fans cheer at Albert Park for the 2022 F1 Australian Grand Prix

props.synopsis: The Victorian government fails to win enough crossbench support for its bill to extend the Australian Formula One Grand Prix from a seven-day event to 21 days.

title.children: Plan to extend Melbourne F1 GP to three weeks shelved

image.altText: A man looks to pass the ball during a rugby league match

props.synopsis: Jamal Fogarty has spent a rugby league lifetime waiting to play on a team like the Raiders. Now with the NRL finals approaching, he's ready for his close-up.

title.children: Jamal Fogarty isn't the perfect halfback but he's the perfect halfback for Canberra
